wiki.content: The song was written by Prince. The Manic Monday Songfacts says: Prince's lifestyle is nothing like the workday grind he pokes fun of in this song, which finds a young lady stressing out about being late for work and trying in vain to get there on time. This being a Prince-penned song from the '80s, there is sex involved: we find out in the last verse that she's late because her lover, who apparently doesn't work, hit her up for some lovemaking the night before. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: The song was written by Prince. This being a Prince-penned song from the '80s, there is sex involved: we find out in the last verse that she's late because her lover, who apparently doesn't work, hit her up for some lovemaking the night before.

track.name: Manic Monday
comments: Blimey - haven't heard this in years............... of course that's tomorrow....... until then.... let me enjoy my Sunday!
Susanna Hoffs is a real cutie.
I like them as much as bannanarama
Best girl band of the 80s...bar none
Today is now monday..."Labor Day" in fact. Patti and I used to love this song. This goes out to you Patti wherever you are.
You can say what you like about the spice girls... But it was the Bangles that put girl bands on the map.
Wish it was Sunday...that's My Fun Day! :):)^
reminds me so damn how much i hate mondays, but today it's saturday, partytime*

In 1986, Prince invited the little-known Bangles to record his song, "Manic Monday." It propelled the LA band to stardom, but it was only a stepping stone for guitarist, Susanna Hoffs, who, two years later, would write The Bangles' most enduring song, "Eternal Flame." Hoffs takes Songfacts behind the scenes of what was, in effect, The Bangles' epitaph - from writing the lyrics with Billy Steinberg, to recording them...in the nude! - http://www.songfacts.com/blog/playingmysong/susanna_hoffs_-_eternal_flame_/
I want to make some bedroom noise with the lead singer either in the 80's or now !!!
Manic monday...tue...wed...thu... any day is perfect for this fantastic song ♥ [2]
Originally intended for the group Apollonia 6 in 1984
these girls rock nice one bangles
Today feels like Monday...lately they all do.
